Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2010 11:49AM mbk wrote: i have been stressed most of my life, but really stressed the last four yrs. also, I had a beautiful garden thanks to lots of weedkillers and fertilizers. i always had trouble w hormones- the pill, pregnancies. like a idiot i took hormone replacements ...so i could keep up with the young kids i worked with...i should just got a face lift.. that would have made me feel just as young (kind of a joke but not) and I wonder if my BC trigger was being in a very polluted country for 3 weeks i felt sick the entire trip...two yrs after my return i was DX and the Dr said i probably had BC for two yrs!  just 2 notes: my little dog died from jaw cancer ..she ate our fertilized grass and hung out in my garden!... i srewed up a lot  i joke on a lot on this site but want you to know i understand the seriousness of what everyone is dealing, joking is my family way of handling the bad stuff and making the good stuff "way more funnier" watched legally blonde last night    mary

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2010 11:27AM mbk wrote: Yea Amen! English Major you are so right on... i know something about Sheryl Crows old boyfriend his first wife is my friend's niece... he may have caused SC some stress too I just rec a letter from a friend discussing the danger of HRT ... i never confront people who send me these type emails but this time i instantly wrote back and said "to late for me i am stage 4" ...she is a smart women but what a dunce i really don't want to be mean but i would like to be hopeful ...stage 1' ers please read the stats for stage 0-1 recovery, they are extremely optimistic...my sister has stage 1 and has been told with her bi-mx, she is cured  hope that will be true for all of you  for no reason at all i am so stressed out today i could burst into tears ...maybe crying will help, or should i go to the pool and hear about my neighbors experience with a physic...  hmmm

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2010 06:29PM mbk wrote: i am not focusing on stats but believe in treatment i not sure what type of bc you have but i am being treated with hormonal therapy and a phase II clinical trail, i am doing very well, very very little side effects, got my energy back and believe i can go a long time on this treatment maybe even forgoing chemo but if not i ready to do whatever it takes, i do take anti anxiety meds which help me not to get too low and enjoy things the stats are old news to me, there are lots of options now and my onc said stage IV is chronic but treatable so i believe i going to dance at my daughters wedding, and she her babies (she 19 and is not even looking for a boyfriend screw the stats and drs....my dad lived 8 yrs longer then the 48 hrs the drs gave him, my brother has lived 40 yrs with a deadly kidney disease (and became a golf pro at 58) and i going to live with stage IV a long long time with love and faith mbk

Posts.Title: losing it jenny66 33skidoo

Posts.Content: mbk wrote: Ok, I was diagnosed with Stage IV BC on Oct 22, 2009 Like many of you, since my DX I have had a double mastectomy, power port installed (right where my purse strap goes) reconstruction surgery I, II, III and IV (Friday I got tits!), psychotherapy, biopsies, bronchoscopy, blood tests, MRI, and variety of scans My treatment: Aromasin, zometa and a phase II clinical trial infusion, anti depressants, anti anxiety, an antacid, a sleep aid, tons of vitamins, starbucks and chocolate ...for medicinal purpose I have done everything in vain! I should have listened to my friends and family, they know the cure for Breast Cancer!  I want you to know you can avoid all the Dr stuff and be "cured" by the following: Some of these "cures" make sense, some are hopeful and some are "interesting" please, please let me know if I am missing one Aspirin, Baking soda, Asparagus, A good attitude, Eat fruit on an empty stomach, Viagra, No alcohol, BC vaccination, Don't drink cold water after meals, Exercise, Soy, Suzanne Somers' "cure", Fish oil, Lots of vitamin D, Solar energy, No Soy, Positive thinking, No sugar, Blueberry diet... or was it watermelon?  A  Miracle.... Despite a bunch of yucky life and BC stuff....I am feeling great! I have energy, and I am very hopeful for a long life .... a miracle to me   mbk Dx 10/16/2009, ILC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 3/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: mbk wrote: I want to add to the recent reports of "good news scans" This is what she (my clinical nurse) wrote today "Everything is stable, no changes in the ground glass appearing patches in the lungs, nothing in the abdomen or pelvis (well, all the normal parts are there).  Report says no change, no change, no change.  No change is good news" PS: My lungs stuff hasn't changed since DX, and I have no symptoms so they really don't know what it is without a biopsy and drs feel no need to do one unless there are changes, and I have a variety of too small to measure spots around kidney and liver....oh yea the spot on my spine cleared up months ago I guess I will stop pouting and go do something .. Eat sweets? Shop? Call daughter? I wish all of you the best too Dx 10/16/2009, ILC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 3/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Lillian1 mbk Cathy2

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2010 08:01PM mbk wrote: HI Fitztwins You are courageous to do a phase I trail! OMG today I was told the same thing "get a power port" I am in a phase II trail at U of MN and it takes the nurses 30 minutes to find my veins but it was my form of denial not to need a port and I hate the thought of having plastic boobs and a metal "thing" in me . March 5th I am having reconstructive part II and port implant surgery My clinical nurse is the best! late one night she emailed me this to me it changed my attitude   "I know cancer is tiresome and does seem to take over your life.  The important thing is to get on with your life and not let it take total control of you.  You are still the same person you were before the diagnosis but now have the additional job of living with cancer.  It is OK to be afraid and frustrated but don't give in.  Make an effort to enjoy your life and do the things that are meaningful to you." good luck love and prayers

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2010 03:06AM - edited Aug 20, 2013 11:01AM by mbk hormonal therapy has kept me stable since my DX one yr ago, i kept asking my onc and clinical trail nurse shouldn't i be on chemo? their respond was NO not now hormonal therapy is more targeted and works well for ER+... we can use many anti-hormonal options for a long time, and IF it progresses then possibly chemo the night before my Bi-Mas i was DX stage IV.. but they decided to go ahead with the surgery and to tell the truth once i got that honking big lump and the BC in my other breast cut out,  i felt physically better then i had for 2 yrs ... and today with the help of drugs, healing, and acceptances i feel good emotionally ...most of the time Nov 2009 BC -IV, Jan 2010 DH had a stint put in ...unemployed, money is tight, can't sell our house and last week my wonderful quirky 20 yr daughter was DX Bi Polar...it is scary but now we understand her sleeping with hammers and screw drivers (paranoia) i will appreciate any prayers for Molly  i have to stick around my family can't handle all this stuff without me  so in ten yrs i will post on this site i have had BC IV for ten yrs BC is hard but did you see Oprah today? i am off topic but thanks for listening
Posts.Title: WANTED: STAGE IV FIVE YEAR SURVIVORS! MCTHO eag1954

Posts.Content: mbk wrote: Hi ladies After reading the responses to "losing it" ... I amazed how everyone reaches out to support us... it is so comforting to know you understand  .... you all are in my heart  but I must let you know .... You can have a hot flash under any conditions or place.... my too cute, too prefect, too young PS fixed my swollen boob but now my ribs are extremely sore, pain killer and ice pack help but today I need to work but can't sit at my desk because of pain Solution: I have belted a ice pack around my ribs, my ribs are freezing and I am having an outrageous hot flash ! ... how does that happen?? have a good day MBK Dx 10/16/2009, ILC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 3/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
